content: Conceptually, numbers are just quantities, but how we represent those quantities can vary. We typically represent numbers in a base-10 number system. What that means is every digit’s place in a number represents a power of 10. That is, the number 123 represents 1×10³ + 2×10¹ + 3×10⁰. However, it is possible to use a number system that is not based on powers of 10. It’s hard to imagine living in a world that uses a non-base-10 number system, but in reality, the way representation numbers is completely arbitrary! So why are we using a 10-based number system? You guessed it — we have 10 fingers!
